00045 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_MDS
00046 
00047 #include <linux/kthread.h>

00049 #include <lustre_obdo.h>

00053 /*
00054  * there are two specific states to take care about:
00055  *
00056  * = import is disconnected =
00057  *
00058  * = import is inactive =
00059  *   in this case osp_declare_object_create() returns an error
00060  *
00061  */
00062 
00063 /*
00064  **
00065  * Check whether statfs data is expired
00066  *
00067  * OSP device caches statfs data for the target, the function checks
00068  * whether the data is expired or not.
00069  *
00070  * \param[in] d         OSP device
00071  *
00072  * \retval              0 - not expired, 1 - expired
00073  */
00074 static inline int osp_statfs_need_update(struct osp_device *d)
00075 {
00076         return !cfs_time_before(cfs_time_current(),
00077                                 d->opd_statfs_fresh_till);
00078 }
00079 
00080 /*
00081  * OSP tries to maintain pool of available objects so that calls to create
00082  * objects don't block most of time
00083  *
00084  * each time OSP gets connected to OST, we should start from precreation cleanup
00085  */
00086 static inline bool osp_precreate_running(struct osp_device *d)
00087 {
00088         return !!(d->opd_pre_thread.t_flags & SVC_RUNNING);
00089 }
00090 
00091 static inline bool osp_precreate_stopped(struct osp_device *d)
00092 {
00093         return !!(d->opd_pre_thread.t_flags & SVC_STOPPED);
00094 }
00095 
00096 static void osp_statfs_timer_cb(unsigned long _d)
00097 {
00098         struct osp_device *d = (struct osp_device *) _d;
00099 
00100         LASSERT(d);
00101         if (d->opd_pre != NULL && osp_precreate_running(d))
00102                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
00103 }
00104 
00121 static int osp_statfs_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00122                                 struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00123                                 union ptlrpc_async_args *aa, int rc)
00124 {
00125         struct obd_import       *imp = req->rq_import;
00126         struct obd_statfs       *msfs;
00127         struct osp_device       *d;
00128 
00129         ENTRY;
00130 
00131         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00132         d = aa->pointer_arg[0];
00133         LASSERT(d);
00134 
00135         if (rc != 0)
00136                 GOTO(out, rc);
00137 
00138         msfs = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_STATFS);
00139         if (msfs == NULL)
00140                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00141 
00142         d->opd_statfs = *msfs;
00143 
00144         osp_pre_update_status(d, rc);
00145 
00146         /* schedule next update */
00147         d->opd_statfs_fresh_till = cfs_time_shift(d->opd_statfs_maxage);
00148         cfs_timer_arm(&d->opd_statfs_timer, d->opd_statfs_fresh_till);
00149         d->opd_statfs_update_in_progress = 0;
00150 
00151         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "updated statfs %p\n", d);
00152 
00153         RETURN(0);
00154 out:
00155         /* couldn't update statfs, try again as soon as possible */
00156         if (d->opd_pre != NULL && osp_precreate_running(d))
00157                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
00158 
00159         if (req->rq_import_generation == imp->imp_generation)
00160                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: couldn't update statfs: rc = %d\n",
00161                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00162         RETURN(rc);
00163 }
00164 
00175 static int osp_statfs_update(struct osp_device *d)
00176 {
00177         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00178         struct obd_import       *imp;
00179         union ptlrpc_async_args *aa;
00180         int                      rc;
00181 
00182         ENTRY;
00183 
00184         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "going to update statfs\n");
00185 
00186         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00187         LASSERT(imp);
00188 
00189         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_STATFS);
00190         if (req == NULL)
00191                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00192 
00193         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_STATFS);
00194         if (rc) {
00195                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00196                 RETURN(rc);
00197         }
00198         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00199         req->rq_request_portal = OST_CREATE_PORTAL;
00200         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00201 
00202         req->rq_interpret_reply = (ptlrpc_interpterer_t)osp_statfs_interpret;
00203         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00204         aa->pointer_arg[0] = d;
00205 
00206         /*
00207          * no updates till reply
00208          */
00209         cfs_timer_disarm(&d->opd_statfs_timer);
00210         d->opd_statfs_fresh_till = cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout * 1000);
00211         d->opd_statfs_update_in_progress = 1;
00212 
00213         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00214 
00215         RETURN(0);
00216 }
00217 
00231 void osp_statfs_need_now(struct osp_device *d)
00232 {
00233         if (!d->opd_statfs_update_in_progress) {
00234                 /*
00235                  * if current status is -ENOSPC (lack of free space on OST)
00236                  * then we should poll OST immediately once object destroy
00237                  * is replied
00238                  */
00239                 d->opd_statfs_fresh_till = cfs_time_shift(-1);
00240                 cfs_timer_disarm(&d->opd_statfs_timer);
00241                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
00242         }
00243 }
00244 
00255 static inline int osp_objs_precreated(const struct lu_env *env,
00256                                       struct osp_device *osp)
00257 {
00258         return osp_fid_diff(&osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid,
00259                             &osp->opd_pre_used_fid);
00260 }
00261 
00276 static inline int osp_precreate_near_empty_nolock(const struct lu_env *env,
00277                                                   struct osp_device *d)
00278 {
00279         int window = osp_objs_precreated(env, d);
00280 
00281         /* don't consider new precreation till OST is healty and
00282          * has free space */
00283         return ((window - d->opd_pre_reserved < d->opd_pre_create_count / 2) &&
00284                 (d->opd_pre_status == 0));
00285 }
00286 
00298 static inline int osp_precreate_near_empty(const struct lu_env *env,
00299                                            struct osp_device *d)
00300 {
00301         int rc;
00302 
00303         /* XXX: do we really need locking here? */
00304         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00305         rc = osp_precreate_near_empty_nolock(env, d);
00306         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00307         return rc;
00308 }
00309 
00322 static inline int osp_create_end_seq(const struct lu_env *env,
00323                                      struct osp_device *osp)
00324 {
00325         struct lu_fid *fid = &osp->opd_pre_used_fid;
00326         int rc;
00327 
00328         spin_lock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00329         rc = osp_fid_end_seq(env, fid);
00330         spin_unlock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00331         return rc;
00332 }
00333 
00349 int osp_write_last_oid_seq_files(struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp,
00350                                  struct lu_fid *fid, int sync)
00351 {
00352         struct osp_thread_info  *oti = osp_env_info(env);
00353         struct lu_buf      *lb_oid = &oti->osi_lb;
00354         struct lu_buf      *lb_oseq = &oti->osi_lb2;
00355         loff_t             oid_off;
00356         loff_t             oseq_off;
00357         struct thandle    *th;
00358         int                   rc;
00359         ENTRY;
00360 
00361         /* Note: through f_oid is only 32 bits, it will also write 64 bits
00362          * for oid to keep compatibility with the previous version. */
00363         lb_oid->lb_buf = &fid->f_oid;
00364         lb_oid->lb_len = sizeof(u64);
00365         oid_off = sizeof(u64) * osp->opd_index;
00366 
00367         lb_oseq->lb_buf = &fid->f_seq;
00368         lb_oseq->lb_len = sizeof(u64);
00369         oseq_off = sizeof(u64) * osp->opd_index;
00370 
00371         th = dt_trans_create(env, osp->opd_storage);
00372         if (IS_ERR(th))
00373                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00374 
00375         th->th_sync |= sync;
00376         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, osp->opd_last_used_oid_file,
00377                                      lb_oid, oid_off, th);
00378         if (rc != 0)
00379                 GOTO(out, rc);
00380 
00381         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, osp->opd_last_used_seq_file,
00382                                      lb_oseq, oseq_off, th);
00383         if (rc != 0)
00384                 GOTO(out, rc);
00385 
00386         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, osp->opd_storage, th);
00387         if (rc != 0)
00388                 GOTO(out, rc);
00389 
00390         rc = dt_record_write(env, osp->opd_last_used_oid_file, lb_oid,
00391                              &oid_off, th);
00392         if (rc != 0) {
00393                 CERROR("%s: can not write to last seq file: rc = %d\n",
00394                         osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00395                 GOTO(out, rc);
00396         }
00397         rc = dt_record_write(env, osp->opd_last_used_seq_file, lb_oseq,
00398                              &oseq_off, th);
00399         if (rc) {
00400                 CERROR("%s: can not write to last seq file: rc = %d\n",
00401                         osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00402                 GOTO(out, rc);
00403         }
00404 out:
00405         dt_trans_stop(env, osp->opd_storage, th);
00406         RETURN(rc);
00407 }
00408 
00428 static int osp_precreate_rollover_new_seq(struct lu_env *env,
00429                                           struct osp_device *osp)
00430 {
00431         struct lu_fid   *fid = &osp_env_info(env)->osi_fid;
00432         struct lu_fid   *last_fid = &osp->opd_last_used_fid;
00433         int             rc;
00434         ENTRY;
00435 
00436         rc = seq_client_get_seq(env, osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq, &fid->f_seq);
00437         if (rc != 0) {
00438                 CERROR("%s: alloc fid error: rc = %d\n",
00439                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00440                 RETURN(rc);
00441         }
00442 
00443         fid->f_oid = 1;
00444         fid->f_ver = 0;
00445         LASSERTF(fid_seq(fid) != fid_seq(last_fid),
00446                  "fid "DFID", last_fid "DFID"\n", PFID(fid),
00447                  PFID(last_fid));
00448 
00449         rc = osp_write_last_oid_seq_files(env, osp, fid, 1);
00450         if (rc != 0) {
00451                 CERROR("%s: Can not update oid/seq file: rc = %d\n",
00452                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00453                 RETURN(rc);
00454         }
00455 
00456         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: update sequence from "LPX64" to "LPX64"\n",
00457                       osp->opd_obd->obd_name, fid_seq(last_fid),
00458                       fid_seq(fid));
00459         /* Update last_xxx to the new seq */
00460         spin_lock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00461         osp->opd_last_used_fid = *fid;
00462         osp->opd_gap_start_fid = *fid;
00463         osp->opd_pre_used_fid = *fid;
00464         osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid = *fid;
00465         spin_unlock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00466 
00467         RETURN(rc);
00468 }
00469 
00488 static int osp_precreate_fids(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp,
00489                               struct lu_fid *fid, int *grow)
00490 {
00491         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00492         __u64                   end;
00493         int                     i = 0;
00494 
00495         if (fid_is_idif(fid)) {
00496                 struct lu_fid   *last_fid;
00497                 struct ost_id   *oi = &osi->osi_oi;
00498 
00499                 spin_lock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00500                 last_fid = &osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid;
00501                 fid_to_ostid(last_fid, oi);
00502                 end = min(ostid_id(oi) + *grow, IDIF_MAX_OID);
00503                 *grow = end - ostid_id(oi);
00504                 ostid_set_id(oi, ostid_id(oi) + *grow);
00505                 spin_unlock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00506 
00507                 if (*grow == 0)
00508                         return 1;
00509 
00510                 ostid_to_fid(fid, oi, osp->opd_index);
00511                 return 0;
00512         }
00513 
00514         spin_lock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00515         *fid = osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid;
00516         end = fid->f_oid;
00517         end = min((end + *grow), (__u64)LUSTRE_DATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH);
00518         *grow = end - fid->f_oid;
00519         fid->f_oid += end - fid->f_oid;
00520         spin_unlock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00521 
00522         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Expect %d, actual %d ["DFID" -- "DFID"]\n",
00523                *grow, i, PFID(fid), PFID(&osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid));
00524 
00525         return *grow > 0 ? 0 : 1;
00526 }
00527 
00543 static int osp_precreate_send(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d)
00544 {
00545         struct osp_thread_info  *oti = osp_env_info(env);
00546         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00547         struct obd_import       *imp;
00548         struct ost_body         *body;
00549         int                      rc, grow, diff;
00550         struct lu_fid           *fid = &oti->osi_fid;
00551         ENTRY;
00552 
00553         /* don't precreate new objects till OST healthy and has free space */
00554         if (unlikely(d->opd_pre_status)) {
00555                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: don't send new precreate: rc = %d\n",
00556                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_pre_status);
00557                 RETURN(0);
00558         }
00559 
00560         /*
00561          * if not connection/initialization is compeleted, ignore
00562          */
00563         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00564         LASSERT(imp);
00565 
00566         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_CREATE);
00567         if (req == NULL)
00568                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00569         req->rq_request_portal = OST_CREATE_PORTAL;
00570         /* we should not resend create request - anyway we will have delorphan
00571          * and kill these objects */
00572         req->rq_no_delay = req->rq_no_resend = 1;
00573 
00574         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_CREATE);
00575         if (rc) {
00576                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00577                 RETURN(rc);
00578         }
00579 
00580         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00581         if (d->opd_pre_create_count > d->opd_pre_max_create_count / 2)
00582                 d->opd_pre_create_count = d->opd_pre_max_create_count / 2;
00583         grow = d->opd_pre_create_count;
00584         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00585 
00586         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00587         LASSERT(body);
00588 
00589         *fid = d->opd_pre_last_created_fid;
00590         rc = osp_precreate_fids(env, d, fid, &grow);
00591         if (rc == 1) {
00592                 /* Current seq has been used up*/
00593                 if (!osp_is_fid_client(d)) {
00594                         osp_pre_update_status(d, -ENOSPC);
00595                         rc = -ENOSPC;
00596                 }
00597                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
00598                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00599         }
00600 
00601         if (!osp_is_fid_client(d)) {
00602                 /* Non-FID client will always send seq 0 because of
00603                  * compatiblity */
00604                 LASSERTF(fid_is_idif(fid), "Invalid fid "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
00605                 fid->f_seq = 0;
00606         }
00607 
00608         fid_to_ostid(fid, &body->oa.o_oi);
00609         body->oa.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
00610 
00611         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00612 
00613         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00614         if (rc) {
00615                 CERROR("%s: can't precreate: rc = %d\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00616                        rc);
00617                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00618         }
00619         LASSERT(req->rq_transno == 0);
00620 
00621         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00622         if (body == NULL)
00623                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -EPROTO);
00624 
00625         ostid_to_fid(fid, &body->oa.o_oi, d->opd_index);
00626         if (osp_fid_diff(fid, &d->opd_pre_used_fid) <= 0) {
00627                 CERROR("%s: precreate fid "DFID" < local used fid "DFID
00628                        ": rc = %d\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00629                        PFID(fid), PFID(&d->opd_pre_used_fid), -ESTALE);
00630                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -ESTALE);
00631         }
00632 
00633         diff = osp_fid_diff(fid, &d->opd_pre_last_created_fid);
00634 
00635         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00636         if (diff < grow) {
00637                 /* the OST has not managed to create all the
00638                  * objects we asked for */
00639                 d->opd_pre_create_count = max(diff, OST_MIN_PRECREATE);
00640                 d->opd_pre_create_slow = 1;
00641         } else {
00642                 /* the OST is able to keep up with the work,
00643                  * we could consider increasing create_count
00644                  * next time if needed */
00645                 d->opd_pre_create_slow = 0;
00646         }
00647 
00648         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00649         fid_to_ostid(fid, &body->oa.o_oi);
00650 
00651         d->opd_pre_last_created_fid = *fid;
00652         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00653 
00654         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: current precreated pool: "DFID"-"DFID"\n",
00655                d->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(&d->opd_pre_used_fid),
00656                PFID(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid));
00657 out_req:
00658         /* now we can wakeup all users awaiting for objects */
00659         osp_pre_update_status(d, rc);
00660         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_user_waitq);
00661 
00662         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00663         RETURN(rc);
00664 }
00665 
00680 static int osp_get_lastfid_from_ost(const struct lu_env *env,
00681                                     struct osp_device *d)
00682 {
00683         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = NULL;
00684         struct obd_import       *imp;
00685         struct lu_fid           *last_fid;
00686         char                    *tmp;
00687         int                     rc;
00688         ENTRY;
00689 
00690         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00691         LASSERT(imp);
00692 
00693         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_GET_INFO_LAST_FID);
00694         if (req == NULL)
00695                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00696 
00697         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_KEY, RCL_CLIENT,
00698                              sizeof(KEY_LAST_FID));
00699 
00700         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_GET_INFO);
00701         if (rc) {
00702                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00703                 RETURN(rc);
00704         }
00705 
00706         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_KEY);
00707         memcpy(tmp, KEY_LAST_FID, sizeof(KEY_LAST_FID));
00708 
00709         req->rq_no_delay = req->rq_no_resend = 1;
00710         last_fid = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_FID);
00711         fid_cpu_to_le(last_fid, &d->opd_last_used_fid);
00712 
00713         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00714 
00715         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00716         if (rc) {
00717                 /* bad-bad OST.. let sysadm sort this out */
00718                 if (rc == -ENOTSUPP) {
00719                         CERROR("%s: server does not support FID: rc = %d\n",
00720                                d->opd_obd->obd_name, -ENOTSUPP);
00721                 }
00722                 ptlrpc_set_import_active(imp, 0);
00723                 GOTO(out, rc);
00724         }
00725 
00726         last_fid = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_FID);
00727         if (last_fid == NULL) {
00728                 CERROR("%s: Got last_fid failed.\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name);
00729                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00730         }
00731 
00732         if (!fid_is_sane(last_fid)) {
00733                 CERROR("%s: Got insane last_fid "DFID"\n",
00734                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(last_fid));
00735                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00736         }
00737 
00738         /* Only update the last used fid, if the OST has objects for
00739          * this sequence, i.e. fid_oid > 0 */
00740         if (fid_oid(last_fid) > 0)
00741                 d->opd_last_used_fid = *last_fid;
00742 
00743         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Got last_fid "DFID"\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00744                PFID(last_fid));
00745 
00746 out:
00747         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00748         RETURN(rc);
00749 }
00750 
00768 static int osp_precreate_cleanup_orphans(struct lu_env *env,
00769                                          struct osp_device *d)
00770 {
00771         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00772         struct lu_fid           *last_fid = &osi->osi_fid;
00773         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = NULL;
00774         struct obd_import       *imp;
00775         struct ost_body         *body;
00776         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
00777         int                      update_status = 0;
00778         int                      rc;
00779         int                      diff;
00780 
00781         ENTRY;
00782 
00783         /*
00784          * wait for local recovery to finish, so we can cleanup orphans
00785          * orphans are all objects since "last used" (assigned), but
00786          * there might be objects reserved and in some cases they won't
00787          * be used. we can't cleanup them till we're sure they won't be
00788          * used. also can't we allow new reservations because they may
00789          * end up getting orphans being cleaned up below. so we block
00790          * new reservations and wait till all reserved objects either
00791          * user or released.
00792          */
00793         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00794         d->opd_pre_recovering = 1;
00795         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00796         /*
00797          * The locking above makes sure the opd_pre_reserved check below will
00798          * catch all osp_precreate_reserve() calls who find
00799          * "!opd_pre_recovering".
00800          */
00801         l_wait_event(d->opd_pre_waitq,
00802                      (!d->opd_pre_reserved && d->opd_recovery_completed) ||
00803                      !osp_precreate_running(d) || d->opd_got_disconnected,
00804                      &lwi);
00805         if (!osp_precreate_running(d) || d->opd_got_disconnected)
00806                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
00807 
00808         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: going to cleanup orphans since "DFID"\n",
00809                d->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(&d->opd_last_used_fid));
00810 
00811         *last_fid = d->opd_last_used_fid;
00812         /* The OSP should already get the valid seq now */
00813         LASSERT(!fid_is_zero(last_fid));
00814         if (fid_oid(&d->opd_last_used_fid) < 2) {
00815                 /* lastfid looks strange... ask OST */
00816                 rc = osp_get_lastfid_from_ost(env, d);
00817                 if (rc)
00818                         GOTO(out, rc);
00819         }
00820 
00821         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00822         LASSERT(imp);
00823 
00824         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_CREATE);
00825         if (req == NULL)
00826                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00827 
00828         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_CREATE);
00829         if (rc) {
00830                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00831                 req = NULL;
00832                 GOTO(out, rc);
00833         }
00834 
00835         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00836         if (body == NULL)
00837                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00838 
00839         body->oa.o_flags = OBD_FL_DELORPHAN;
00840         body->oa.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLFLAGS | OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
00841 
00842         fid_to_ostid(&d->opd_last_used_fid, &body->oa.o_oi);
00843 
00844         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00845 
00846         /* Don't resend the delorphan req */
00847         req->rq_no_resend = req->rq_no_delay = 1;
00848 
00849         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00850         if (rc) {
00851                 update_status = 1;
00852                 GOTO(out, rc);
00853         }
00854 
00855         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00856         if (body == NULL)
00857                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00858 
00859         /*
00860          * OST provides us with id new pool starts from in body->oa.o_id
00861          */
00862         ostid_to_fid(last_fid, &body->oa.o_oi, d->opd_index);
00863 
00864         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00865         diff = osp_fid_diff(&d->opd_last_used_fid, last_fid);
00866         if (diff > 0) {
00867                 d->opd_pre_create_count = OST_MIN_PRECREATE + diff;
00868                 d->opd_pre_last_created_fid = d->opd_last_used_fid;
00869         } else {
00870                 d->opd_pre_create_count = OST_MIN_PRECREATE;
00871                 d->opd_pre_last_created_fid = *last_fid;
00872         }
00873         /*
00874          * This empties the pre-creation pool and effectively blocks any new
00875          * reservations.
00876          */
00877         LASSERT(fid_oid(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid) <=
00878                 LUSTRE_DATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH);
00879         d->opd_pre_used_fid = d->opd_pre_last_created_fid;
00880         d->opd_pre_create_slow = 0;
00881         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00882 
00883         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Got last_id "DFID" from OST, last_created "DFID
00884                "last_used is "DFID"\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(last_fid),
00885                PFID(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid), PFID(&d->opd_last_used_fid));
00886 out:
00887         if (req)
00888                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00889 
00890         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00891         d->opd_pre_recovering = 0;
00892         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00893 
00894         /*
00895          * If rc is zero, the pre-creation window should have been emptied.
00896          * Since waking up the herd would be useless without pre-created
00897          * objects, we defer the signal to osp_precreate_send() in that case.
00898          */
00899         if (rc != 0) {
00900                 if (update_status) {
00901                         CERROR("%s: cannot cleanup orphans: rc = %d\n",
00902                                d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00903                         /* we can't proceed from here, OST seem to
00904                          * be in a bad shape, better to wait for
00905                          * a new instance of the server and repeat
00906                          * from the beginning. notify possible waiters
00907                          * this OSP isn't quite functional yet */
00908                         osp_pre_update_status(d, rc);
00909                 } else {
00910                         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_user_waitq);
00911                 }
00912         }
00913 
00914         RETURN(rc);
00915 }
00916 
00948 void osp_pre_update_status(struct osp_device *d, int rc)
00949 {
00950         struct obd_statfs       *msfs = &d->opd_statfs;
00951         int                      old = d->opd_pre_status;
00952         __u64                    used;
00953 
00954         d->opd_pre_status = rc;
00955         if (rc)
00956                 goto out;
00957 
00958         if (likely(msfs->os_type)) {
00959                 used = min_t(__u64, (msfs->os_blocks - msfs->os_bfree) >> 10,
00960                                     1 << 30);
00961                 if ((msfs->os_ffree < 32) || (msfs->os_bavail < used)) {
00962                         d->opd_pre_status = -ENOSPC;
00963                         if (old != -ENOSPC)
00964                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: status: "LPU64" blocks, "
00965                                        LPU64" free, "LPU64" used, "LPU64" "
00966                                        "avail -> %d: rc = %d\n",
00967                                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, msfs->os_blocks,
00968                                        msfs->os_bfree, used, msfs->os_bavail,
00969                                        d->opd_pre_status, rc);
00970                         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
00971                                "non-committed changes: %lu, in progress: %u\n",
00972                                d->opd_syn_changes, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress);
00973                 } else if (old == -ENOSPC) {
00974                         d->opd_pre_status = 0;
00975                         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00976                         d->opd_pre_create_slow = 0;
00977                         d->opd_pre_create_count = OST_MIN_PRECREATE;
00978                         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00979                         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
00980                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: no space: "LPU64" blocks, "LPU64
00981                                " free, "LPU64" used, "LPU64" avail -> %d: "
00982                                "rc = %d\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00983                                msfs->os_blocks, msfs->os_bfree, used,
00984                                msfs->os_bavail, d->opd_pre_status, rc);
00985                 }
00986         }
00987 
00988 out:
00989         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_user_waitq);
00990 }
00991 
01008 int osp_init_pre_fid(struct osp_device *osp)
01009 {
01010         struct lu_env           env;
01011         struct osp_thread_info  *osi;
01012         struct lu_client_seq    *cli_seq;
01013         struct lu_fid           *last_fid;
01014         int                     rc;
01015         ENTRY;
01016 
01017         LASSERT(osp->opd_pre != NULL);
01018 
01019         /* Return if last_used fid has been initialized */
01020         if (!fid_is_zero(&osp->opd_last_used_fid))
01021                 RETURN(0);
01022 
01023         rc = lu_env_init(&env, osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_type->ldt_ctx_tags);
01024         if (rc) {
01025                 CERROR("%s: init env error: rc = %d\n",
01026                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01027                 RETURN(rc);
01028         }
01029 
01030         osi = osp_env_info(&env);
01031         last_fid = &osi->osi_fid;
01032         fid_zero(last_fid);
01033         /* For a freshed fs, it will allocate a new sequence first */
01034         if (osp_is_fid_client(osp) && osp->opd_group != 0) {
01035                 cli_seq = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq;
01036                 rc = seq_client_get_seq(&env, cli_seq, &last_fid->f_seq);
01037                 if (rc != 0) {
01038                         CERROR("%s: alloc fid error: rc = %d\n",
01039                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01040                         GOTO(out, rc);
01041                 }
01042         } else {
01043                 last_fid->f_seq = fid_idif_seq(0, osp->opd_index);
01044         }
01045         last_fid->f_oid = 1;
01046         last_fid->f_ver = 0;
01047 
01048         spin_lock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
01049         osp->opd_last_used_fid = *last_fid;
01050         osp->opd_pre_used_fid = *last_fid;
01051         osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid = *last_fid;
01052         spin_unlock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
01053         rc = osp_write_last_oid_seq_files(&env, osp, last_fid, 1);
01054         if (rc != 0) {
01055                 CERROR("%s: write fid error: rc = %d\n",
01056                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01057                 GOTO(out, rc);
01058         }
01059 out:
01060         lu_env_fini(&env);
01061         RETURN(rc);
01062 }
01063 
01082 static int osp_precreate_thread(void *_arg)
01083 {
01084         struct osp_device       *d = _arg;
01085         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread = &d->opd_pre_thread;
01086         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
01087         struct lu_env            env;
01088         int                      rc;
01089 
01090         ENTRY;
01091 
01092         rc = lu_env_init(&env, d->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_type->ldt_ctx_tags);
01093         if (rc) {
01094                 CERROR("%s: init env error: rc = %d\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
01095                        rc);
01096                 RETURN(rc);
01097         }
01098 
01099         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01100         thread->t_flags = SVC_RUNNING;
01101         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01102         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01103 
01104         while (osp_precreate_running(d)) {
01105                 /*
01106                  * need to be connected to OST
01107                  */
01108                 while (osp_precreate_running(d)) {
01109                         l_wait_event(d->opd_pre_waitq,
01110                                      !osp_precreate_running(d) ||
01111                                      d->opd_new_connection,
01112                                      &lwi);
01113 
01114                         if (!d->opd_new_connection)
01115                                 continue;
01116 
01117                         d->opd_new_connection = 0;
01118                         d->opd_got_disconnected = 0;
01119                         break;
01120                 }
01121 
01122                 if (!osp_precreate_running(d))
01123                         break;
01124 
01125                 LASSERT(d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq != NULL);
01126                 /* Sigh, fid client is not ready yet */
01127                 if (d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq->lcs_exp == NULL)
01128                         continue;
01129 
01130                 /* Init fid for osp_precreate if necessary */
01131                 rc = osp_init_pre_fid(d);
01132                 if (rc != 0) {
01133                         class_export_put(d->opd_exp);
01134                         d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq->lcs_exp = NULL;
01135                         CERROR("%s: init pre fid error: rc = %d\n",
01136                                d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01137                         continue;
01138                 }
01139 
01140                 osp_statfs_update(d);
01141 
01142                 /*
01143                  * Clean up orphans or recreate missing objects.
01144                  */
01145                 rc = osp_precreate_cleanup_orphans(&env, d);
01146                 if (rc != 0)
01147                         continue;
01148                 /*
01149                  * connected, can handle precreates now
01150                  */
01151                 while (osp_precreate_running(d)) {
01152                         l_wait_event(d->opd_pre_waitq,
01153                                      !osp_precreate_running(d) ||
01154                                      osp_precreate_near_empty(&env, d) ||
01155                                      osp_statfs_need_update(d) ||
01156                                      d->opd_got_disconnected, &lwi);
01157 
01158                         if (!osp_precreate_running(d))
01159                                 break;
01160 
01161                         /* something happened to the connection
01162                          * have to start from the beginning */
01163                         if (d->opd_got_disconnected)
01164                                 break;
01165 
01166                         if (osp_statfs_need_update(d))
01167                                 osp_statfs_update(d);
01168 
01169                         /* To avoid handling different seq in precreate/orphan
01170                          * cleanup, it will hold precreate until current seq is
01171                          * used up. */
01172                         if (unlikely(osp_precreate_end_seq(&env, d) &&
01173                             !osp_create_end_seq(&env, d)))
01174                                 continue;
01175 
01176                         if (unlikely(osp_precreate_end_seq(&env, d) &&
01177                                      osp_create_end_seq(&env, d))) {
01178                                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s:"LPX64" is used up."
01179                                               " Update to new seq\n",
01180                                               d->opd_obd->obd_name,
01181                                          fid_seq(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid));
01182                                 rc = osp_precreate_rollover_new_seq(&env, d);
01183                                 if (rc)
01184                                         continue;
01185                         }
01186 
01187                         if (osp_precreate_near_empty(&env, d)) {
01188                                 rc = osp_precreate_send(&env, d);
01189                                 /* osp_precreate_send() sets opd_pre_status
01190                                  * in case of error, that prevent the using of
01191                                  * failed device. */
01192                                 if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOSPC &&
01193                                     rc != -ETIMEDOUT && rc != -ENOTCONN)
01194                                         CERROR("%s: cannot precreate objects:"
01195                                                " rc = %d\n",
01196                                                d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01197                         }
01198                 }
01199         }
01200 
01201         thread->t_flags = SVC_STOPPED;
01202         lu_env_fini(&env);
01203         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01204 
01205         RETURN(0);
01206 }
01207 
01222 static int osp_precreate_ready_condition(const struct lu_env *env,
01223                                          struct osp_device *d)
01224 {
01225         if (d->opd_pre_recovering)
01226                 return 0;
01227 
01228         /* ready if got enough precreated objects */
01229         /* we need to wait for others (opd_pre_reserved) and our object (+1) */
01230         if (d->opd_pre_reserved + 1 < osp_objs_precreated(env, d))
01231                 return 1;
01232 
01233         /* ready if OST reported no space and no destroys in progress */
01234         if (d->opd_syn_changes + d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress == 0 &&
01235             d->opd_pre_status == -ENOSPC)
01236                 return 1;
01237 
01238         /* Bail out I/O fails to OST */
01239         if (d->opd_pre_status != 0 &&
01240             d->opd_pre_status != -EAGAIN &&
01241             d->opd_pre_status != -ENODEV &&
01242             d->opd_pre_status != -ENOSPC) {
01243                 /* DEBUG LU-3230 */
01244                 if (d->opd_pre_status != -EIO)
01245                         CERROR("%s: precreate failed opd_pre_status %d\n",
01246                                d->opd_obd->obd_name, d->opd_pre_status);
01247                 return 1;
01248         }
01249 
01250         return 0;
01251 }
01252 
01253 static int osp_precreate_timeout_condition(void *data)
01254 {
01255         struct osp_device *d = data;
01256 
01257         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: slow creates, last="DFID", next="DFID", "
01258               "reserved="LPU64", syn_changes=%lu, "
01259               "syn_rpc_in_progress=%d, status=%d\n",
01260               d->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid),
01261               PFID(&d->opd_pre_used_fid), d->opd_pre_reserved,
01262               d->opd_syn_changes, d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress,
01263               d->opd_pre_status);
01264 
01265         return 1;
01266 }
01267 
01292 int osp_precreate_reserve(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d)
01293 {
01294         struct l_wait_info       lwi;
01295         cfs_time_t               expire = cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout);
01296         int                      precreated, rc;
01297 
01298         ENTRY;
01299 
01300         LASSERTF(osp_objs_precreated(env, d) >= 0, "Last created FID "DFID
01301                  "Next FID "DFID"\n", PFID(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid),
01302                  PFID(&d->opd_pre_used_fid));
01303 
01304         /*
01305          * wait till:
01306          *  - preallocation is done
01307          *  - no free space expected soon
01308          *  - can't connect to OST for too long (obd_timeout)
01309          *  - OST can allocate fid sequence.
01310          */
01311         while ((rc = d->opd_pre_status) == 0 || rc == -ENOSPC ||
01312                 rc == -ENODEV || rc == -EAGAIN || rc == -ENOTCONN) {
01313 
01314                 /*
01315                  * increase number of precreations
01316                  */
01317                 precreated = osp_objs_precreated(env, d);
01318                 if (d->opd_pre_create_count < d->opd_pre_max_create_count &&
01319                     d->opd_pre_create_slow == 0 &&
01320                     precreated <= (d->opd_pre_create_count / 4 + 1)) {
01321                         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01322                         d->opd_pre_create_slow = 1;
01323                         d->opd_pre_create_count *= 2;
01324                         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01325                 }
01326 
01327                 spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01328                 precreated = osp_objs_precreated(env, d);
01329                 if (precreated > d->opd_pre_reserved &&
01330                     !d->opd_pre_recovering) {
01331                         d->opd_pre_reserved++;
01332                         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01333                         rc = 0;
01334 
01335                         /* XXX: don't wake up if precreation is in progress */
01336                         if (osp_precreate_near_empty_nolock(env, d) &&
01337                            !osp_precreate_end_seq_nolock(env, d))
01338                                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01339 
01340                         break;
01341                 }
01342                 spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01343 
01344                 /*
01345                  * all precreated objects have been used and no-space
01346                  * status leave us no chance to succeed very soon
01347                  * but if there is destroy in progress, then we should
01348                  * wait till that is done - some space might be released
01349                  */
01350                 if (unlikely(rc == -ENOSPC)) {
01351                         if (d->opd_syn_changes) {
01352                                 /* force local commit to release space */
01353                                 dt_commit_async(env, d->opd_storage);
01354                         }
01355                         if (d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress) {
01356                                 /* just wait till destroys are done */
01357                                 /* see l_wait_even() few lines below */
01358                         }
01359                         if (d->opd_syn_changes +
01360                             d->opd_syn_rpc_in_progress == 0) {
01361                                 /* no hope for free space */
01362                                 break;
01363                         }
01364                 }
01365 
01366                 /* XXX: don't wake up if precreation is in progress */
01367                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01368 
01369                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(expire - cfs_time_current(),
01370                                 osp_precreate_timeout_condition, d);
01371                 if (cfs_time_aftereq(cfs_time_current(), expire)) {
01372                         rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
01373                         break;
01374                 }
01375 
01376                 l_wait_event(d->opd_pre_user_waitq,
01377                              osp_precreate_ready_condition(env, d), &lwi);
01378         }
01379 
01380         RETURN(rc);
01381 }
01382 
01405 int osp_precreate_get_fid(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d,
01406                           struct lu_fid *fid)
01407 {
01408         /* grab next id from the pool */
01409         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01410 
01411         LASSERTF(osp_fid_diff(&d->opd_pre_used_fid,
01412                              &d->opd_pre_last_created_fid) < 0,
01413                  "next fid "DFID" last created fid "DFID"\n",
01414                  PFID(&d->opd_pre_used_fid),
01415                  PFID(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid));
01416 
01417         d->opd_pre_used_fid.f_oid++;
01418         memcpy(fid, &d->opd_pre_used_fid, sizeof(*fid));
01419         d->opd_pre_reserved--;
01420         /*
01421          * last_used_id must be changed along with getting new id otherwise
01422          * we might miscalculate gap causing object loss or leak
01423          */
01424         osp_update_last_fid(d, fid);
01425         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01426 
01427         /*
01428          * probably main thread suspended orphan cleanup till
01429          * all reservations are released, see comment in
01430          * osp_precreate_thread() just before orphan cleanup
01431          */
01432         if (unlikely(d->opd_pre_reserved == 0 && d->opd_pre_status))
01433                 wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01434 
01435         return 0;
01436 }
01437 
01438 /*
01439  * Set size regular attribute on an object
01440  *
01441  * When a striping is created late, it's possible that size is already
01442  * initialized on the file. Then the new striping should inherit size
01443  * from the file. The function sets size on the object using the regular
01444  * protocol (OST_PUNCH).
01445  * XXX: should be re-implemented using OUT ?
01446  *
01447  * \param[in] env       LU environment provided by the caller
01448  * \param[in] dt        object
01449  * \param[in] size      size to set.
01450  *
01451  * \retval 0            on success
01452  * \retval negative     negated errno on error
01453  */
01454 int osp_object_truncate(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01455                         __u64 size)
01456 {
01457         struct osp_device       *d = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01458         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = NULL;
01459         struct obd_import       *imp;
01460         struct ost_body         *body;
01461         struct obdo             *oa = NULL;
01462         int                      rc;
01463 
01464         ENTRY;
01465 
01466         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01467         LASSERT(imp);
01468 
01469         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_PUNCH);
01470         if (req == NULL)
01471                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01472 
01473         /* XXX: capa support? */
01474         /* osc_set_capa_size(req, &RMF_CAPA1, capa); */
01475         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_PUNCH);
01476         if (rc) {
01477                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01478                 RETURN(rc);
01479         }
01480 
01481         /*
01482          * XXX: decide how do we do here with resend
01483          * if we don't resend, then client may see wrong file size
01484          * if we do resend, then MDS thread can get stuck for quite long
01485          */
01486         req->rq_no_resend = req->rq_no_delay = 1;
01487 
01488         req->rq_request_portal = OST_IO_PORTAL; /* bug 7198 */
01489         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
01490 
01491         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oa);
01492         if (oa == NULL)
01493                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01494 
01495         rc = fid_to_ostid(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu), &oa->o_oi);
01496         LASSERT(rc == 0);
01497         oa->o_size = size;
01498         oa->o_blocks = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
01499         oa->o_valid = OBD_MD_FLSIZE | OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS |
01500                       OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
01501 
01502         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
01503         LASSERT(body);
01504         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
01505 
01506         /* XXX: capa support? */
01507         /* osc_pack_capa(req, body, capa); */
01508 
01509         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01510 
01511         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01512         if (rc)
01513                 CERROR("can't punch object: %d\n", rc);
01514 out:
01515         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01516         if (oa)
01517                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oa);
01518         RETURN(rc);
01519 }
01520 
01531 int osp_init_precreate(struct osp_device *d)
01532 {
01533         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
01534         struct task_struct              *task;
01535 
01536         ENTRY;
01537 
01538         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(d->opd_pre);
01539         if (d->opd_pre == NULL)
01540                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01541 
01542         /* initially precreation isn't ready */
01543         d->opd_pre_status = -EAGAIN;
01544         fid_zero(&d->opd_pre_used_fid);
01545         d->opd_pre_used_fid.f_oid = 1;
01546         fid_zero(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid);
01547         d->opd_pre_last_created_fid.f_oid = 1;
01548         d->opd_pre_reserved = 0;
01549         d->opd_got_disconnected = 1;
01550         d->opd_pre_create_slow = 0;
01551         d->opd_pre_create_count = OST_MIN_PRECREATE;
01552         d->opd_pre_min_create_count = OST_MIN_PRECREATE;
01553         d->opd_pre_max_create_count = OST_MAX_PRECREATE;
01554 
01555         spin_lock_init(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01556         init_waitqueue_head(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01557         init_waitqueue_head(&d->opd_pre_user_waitq);
01558         init_waitqueue_head(&d->opd_pre_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
01559 
01560         /*
01561          * Initialize statfs-related things
01562          */
01563         d->opd_statfs_maxage = 5; /* default update interval */
01564         d->opd_statfs_fresh_till = cfs_time_shift(-1000);
01565         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "current %llu, fresh till %llu\n",
01566                (unsigned long long)cfs_time_current(),
01567                (unsigned long long)d->opd_statfs_fresh_till);
01568         cfs_timer_init(&d->opd_statfs_timer, osp_statfs_timer_cb, d);
01569 
01570         /*
01571          * start thread handling precreation and statfs updates
01572          */
01573         task = kthread_run(osp_precreate_thread, d,
01574                            "osp-pre-%u-%u", d->opd_index, d->opd_group);
01575         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01576                 CERROR("can't start precreate thread %ld\n", PTR_ERR(task));
01577                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(task));
01578         }
01579 
01580         l_wait_event(d->opd_pre_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
01581                      osp_precreate_running(d) || osp_precreate_stopped(d),
01582                      &lwi);
01583 
01584         RETURN(0);
01585 }
01586 
01596 void osp_precreate_fini(struct osp_device *d)
01597 {
01598         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread;
01599 
01600         ENTRY;
01601 
01602         cfs_timer_disarm(&d->opd_statfs_timer);
01603 
01604         if (d->opd_pre == NULL)
01605                 RETURN_EXIT;
01606 
01607         thread = &d->opd_pre_thread;
01608 
01609         thread->t_flags = SVC_STOPPING;
01610         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01611 
01612         wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq, thread->t_flags & SVC_STOPPED);
01613 
01614         OBD_FREE_PTR(d->opd_pre);
01615         d->opd_pre = NULL;
01616 
01617         EXIT;
01618 }
